You will play a game with 100 rounds.
In each round you'll see active cues (chooseable):
One quadrant has 90% one color/10% other
Other quadrants have 50/50 color distribution
At least one cue active per round
Active cues disappear after random duration

After 100 rounds, identify the biased quadrant.
Correct: +100 points, Wrong: -100 points.

Other quadrants have 50/50 color distribution

Active cues disappear after random duration

After 100 rounds, identify the biased quadrant.
Correct: +100 points, Wrong: -100 points.

Round 1: Available cues A, C, D. You chose A and saw RED.
Round 2: Available cues B, C. You chose B and saw GREEN.
Round 3: Available cues C, D. You chose C and saw RED.
Round 4: Available cues B. You chose C and saw Invalid choice.
Round 5: Available cues B. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 6: Available cues A, C, D. You chose D and saw RED.
Round 7: Available cues D. Based on previous observations, choose one cue by responding with just the letter. You press <<

At least one cue active per round
Active cues disappear after random duration

FINAL_ACCUMULATED_PROMPT:
----------------------------------------
You will play a game with 100 rounds.
In each round you'll see active cues (chooseable):
One quadrant has 90% one color/10% other
Other quadrants have 50/50 color distribution
At least one cue active per round
Active cues disappear after random duration

After 100 rounds, identify the biased quadrant.
Correct: +100 points, Wrong: -100 points.

Round 1: Available cues A, C, D. You chose A and saw GREEN.
Round 2: Available cues A, B, C, D. You chose Based and saw Invalid choice.
Round 3: Available cues B, C. You chose B and saw GREEN.

After 100 rounds, identify the biased quadrant.
Correct: +100 points, Wrong: -100 points.

Round 1: Available cues A. You chose To and saw Invalid choice.
Round 2: Available cues B, D. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 3: Available cues C. You chose C and saw RED.
Round 4: Available cues A, C. You chose C and saw GREEN.
Round 5: Available cues B, C, D. Based on previous observations, choose one cue by responding with just the letter. You press <<

ACCUMULATED_PROMPT:
----------------------------------------
You will play a game with 100 rounds.
In each round you'll see active cues (chooseable):
One quadrant has 90% one color/10% other
Other quadrants have 50/50 color distribution
At least one cue active per round
Active cues disappear after random duration

After 100 rounds, identify the biased quadrant.
Correct: +100 points, Wrong: -100 points.

Round 1: Available cues A, B, C, D. You chose Given and saw Invalid choice.
Round 2: Available cues B, C. You chose Please and saw Invalid choice.
Round 3: Available cues C. You chose C and saw RED.
Round 4: Available cues A. You chose C and saw Invalid choice.
Round 5: Available cues A, C, D. You chose A and saw RED.
Round 6: Available cues A, B, C, D. You chose A and saw GREEN.
Round 7: Available cues C. You chose A and saw Invalid choice.
Round 8: Available cues A, B, C, D. You chose A and saw RED.
Round 9: Available cues B, D. You chose A and saw Invalid choice.

In each round you'll see active cues (chooseable):
One quadrant has 90% one color/10% other
Other quadrants have 50/50 color distribution
At least one cue active per round
Active cues disappear after random duration

After 100 rounds, identify the biased quadrant.
Correct: +100 points, Wrong: -100 points.

Round 1: Available cues A, B, C, D. You chose Given and saw Invalid choice.
Round 2: Available cues B, C. You chose Please and saw Invalid choice.
Round 3: Available cues C. You chose C and saw RED.

Round 8: Available cues C, D. You chose A and saw Invalid choice.

Active cues disappear after random duration

After 100 rounds, identify the biased quadrant.
Correct: +100 points, Wrong: -100 points.

----------------------------------------
RED

ACCUMULATED_PROMPT:
----------------------------------------
You will play a game with 100 rounds.
In each round you'll see active cues (chooseable):
One quadrant has 90% one color/10% other
Other quadrants have 50/50 color distribution
At least one cue active per round
Active cues disappear after random duration

After 100 rounds, identify the biased quadrant.
Correct: +100 points, Wrong: -100 points.

Round 1: Available cues C, D. You chose C and saw GREEN.
Round 2: Available cues A, C, D. You chose C and saw GREEN.
Round 3: Available cues D. You chose D and saw RED.
Round 4: Available cues C. You chose C and saw RED.
Round 5: Available cues D. You chose C and saw Invalid choice.
Round 6: Available cues A, B, C. You chose C and saw RED.
Round 7: Available cues A, B, D. You chose C and saw Invalid choice.
Round 8: Available cues A, B, D. You chose A and saw RED.
Round 9: Available cues B. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 10: Available cues A, C, D. You chose C and saw GREEN.
Round 11: Available cues B, C. You chose C and saw RED.
Round 12: Available cues A, D. You chose C and saw Invalid choice.
Round 13: Available cues C, D. You chose C and saw GREEN.
Round 14: Available cues A, C. You chose C and saw RED.
Round 15: Available cues B, D. You chose C and saw Invalid choice.
Round 16: Available cues B, D. You chose C and saw Invalid choice.
Round 17: Available cues A, B, D. You chose C and saw Invalid choice.
Round 18: Available cues B, D. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 19: Available cues A, D. You chose C and saw Invalid choice.
Round 20: Available cues A, B, C, D. You chose C and saw RED.
Round 21: Available cues B, C. You chose C and saw RED.
Round 22: Available cues A, B. You chose C and saw Invalid choice.
Round 23: Available cues A. You chose C and saw Invalid choice.
Round 24: Available cues C, D. You chose C and saw RED.
Round 25: Available cues A, B, C. You chose C and saw GREEN.
Round 26: Available cues A, C. You chose C and saw GREEN.
Round 27: Available cues C. You chose C and saw RED.
Round 28: Available cues A, B. You chose C and saw Invalid choice.
Round 29: Available cues B, C. You chose C and saw RED.
Round 30: Available cues D. You chose C and saw Invalid choice.
Round 31: Available cues C, D. You chose C and saw GREEN.
Round 32: Available cues B, C, D. You chose C and saw GREEN.
Round 33: Available cues A, C, D. You chose C and saw GREEN.
Round 34: Available cues A, C, D. You chose C and saw RED.
Round 35: Available cues A, B, C. You chose C and saw RED.

Round 5: Available cues D. You chose C and saw Invalid choice.
Round 6: Available cues A, B, C. You chose C and saw RED.
Round 7: Available cues A, B, D. You chose C and saw Invalid choice.
Round 8: Available cues A, B, D. You chose A and saw RED.
Round 9: Available cues B. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 10: Available cues A, C, D. You chose C and saw GREEN.
Round 11: Available cues B, C. You chose C and saw RED.
Round 12: Available cues A, D. You chose C and saw Invalid choice.

Other quadrants have 50/50 color distribution
At least one cue active per round
Active cues disappear after random duration

After 100 rounds, identify the biased quadrant.
Correct: +100 points, Wrong: -100 points.

Round 1: Available cues B, C, D. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 2: Available cues A, B, C. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 3: Available cues A, D. You chose D and saw RED.
Round 4: Available cues B. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 5: Available cues B, C, D. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 6: Available cues A, B. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 7: Available cues A, B. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 8: Available cues B, D. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 9: Available cues B, C. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 10: Available cues C, D. You chose B and saw Invalid choice.
Round 11: Available cues D. You chose B and saw Invalid choice.
Round 12: Available cues A, B. You chose B and saw GREEN.
Round 13: Available cues A. You chose B and saw Invalid choice.
